text: Anyone know of a tool that can determine the longest string a regex can accept?

elements.text: Anyone know of a tool that can determine the longest string a regex can accept?

text: I'm worried that to be able to do this you'd effectively need a Regex parser...

elements.text: I'm worried that to be able to do this you'd effectively need a Regex parser...

text: With `+` and `*` it would be effectively infinite, right?

elements.text: it would be effectively infinite, right?

text: sure, `.*` matches any string after all

Yes, with `+` and `*` it would be infinite.
Which makes answering it for those cases easy.
Depending how you think of regex also any that didn’t have a `^` or a `$` would be infinite too.

>  I’m worried that to be able to do this you’d effectively need a Regex parser...
You definitely would.

The algorithm to do this would be something like:
reduce the regex to a finite state machine.
Representat that finite state machine as a graph (discard transition requirments).
Check if it contains cycles? If so return infinite.
If not find the longest path with in the graph.
